headline: 2025-11-03 — Eighteen Canadian pediatric tertiary care hospitals (surveyed) reported a 100% response rate and that 13 of 18 hospitals (72.2%) maintain pediatric-specific massive hemorrhage protocol (MHP) content.
2025-11-04 — Among pediatric-specific MHPs, 12 of 13 (92.3%) recommended initial ratio-based blood component transfusion before transitioning to laboratory-guided transfusion.
2025-11-05 — The surveyed pediatric MHPs reported transport-container content variability: 8 of 13 pediatric MHPs (61.5%) included only red blood cell (RBC) units in the first container.
